title: The Archaeology of Shamanism
description:
The Archaeology of Shamanism
edited by Neil Price

255 pp., PDF

Neil Price brings together archaeological thought on shamanism, addressing shamanic material culture, responses to dying and the dead, shamanism in the context of other belief systems (such as totemism), shamanic soundscapes, and the use of ritual architecture. With case studies from the arctic Greenland to Africa and from Europe to Asia this work covers the Palaeolithic to the present day. 

Please check my torrents for several reference works on shamanism, as well as on other topics. As always, please seed!
